Title: DM - Districts - Streets - Search Streets

Test Steps.Step Action: Pre-requisite: Have an existing street and a voter assigned to that street segment
Test Steps.Step Expected: \n

Test Steps.Step Action: Access EMS
Test Steps.Step Expected: Dashboard is displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Navigate to District Management > Districts > View Streets
Test Steps.Step Expected: Search Streets page is displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Select a Street from the "Street Name" dropdown and click "Search"
Test Steps.Step Expected: All the Street Segments under that Street Name will be listed

Test Steps.Step Action: Choose a desired Street Segment and click on the Action ellipsis
Test Steps.Step Expected: Options displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on "View"
Test Steps.Step Expected: All the voters that are assigned to that Street Segment will be listed below

Test Steps.Step Action: Choose a desired Voter and click on the Action ellipsis\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: Options displayed\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on "View"\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: User will be taken to the View Voter screen for that particular Voter

Title: DM - Districts - Street Segments - Add New Street

Test Steps.Step Action: Access the EMS system
Test Steps.Step Expected: Dashboard displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Navigate to District Management > Districts > Manage Streets
Test Steps.Step Expected: Street Segments page is displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "ADD"
Test Steps.Step Expected: Add/Update Street Segment page is displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Fill in all required fields and click "Save"
Test Steps.Step Expected: The Street will be successfully created

Test Steps.Step Action: Select the street you just created from the "Street Name" dropdown and click "Search"
Test Steps.Step Expected: The Street you just created will be displayed showing the Street Segment

Title: DM - Districts - Street Segments - Add Street Segment to existing Street

Test Steps.Step Action: Access the EMS system\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: Dashboard displayed\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Navigate to District Management > Districts > Manage Streets\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: Street Segments page is displayed\n

Test Steps.Step Action: From the "Street Name" dropdown select a desired Street
Test Steps.Step Expected: Street selected

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "ADD"\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: Add/Update Street Segment page is displayed\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Fill in all required fields and click "Save"\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: The Street will be successfully created\n

Test Steps.Step Action: From the "Street Name" dropdown select the Street you just created and Street Segment for and click "Search"\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: The new Street segment you just created will be displayed alongside the existing segments\n

Title: DM - Districts - Street Segments - Edit existing Street Segment

Test Steps.Step Action: Pre-requisite:\n- Have an existing Street with Segments
Test Steps.Step Expected: \n

Test Steps.Step Action: Access the EMS system\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: Dashboard displayed\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Navigate to District Management > Districts > Manage Streets\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: Street Segments page is displayed\n

Test Steps.Step Action: From the "Street Name" dropdown select a desired Street\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: Street selected\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "SEARCH"
Test Steps.Step Expected: All Street Segments are displayed for that chosen Street

Test Steps.Step Action: Choose a desired Street Segment and click on the Actions ellipsis
Test Steps.Step Expected: Options displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "Edit"
Test Steps.Step Expected: Add / Update page is displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Change the Street Segment in any way desired e.g. Postal City
Test Steps.Step Expected: Street Segment changed

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "UPDATE"
Test Steps.Step Expected: Street Segment updated

Test Steps.Step Action: From the "Street Name" dropdown select the Street with the Segment you just edited and click "SEARCH"
Test Steps.Step Expected: Street Segments will be listed and the changes you made will be reflected on the Street Segment you edited

Title: DM - Districts - Special Address - Add New Business Address

Test Steps.Step Expected: Street Name selected

Test Steps.Step Action: From the "Street Segment" dropdown select a desired Street Segment
Test Steps.Step Expected: Street Segment selected

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "SEARCH"

Test Steps.Step Expected: Add Business Address page is displayed

Test Steps.Step Expected: Street Segment selected

Title: 77526 - DM - District - Precinct Split - Add/Delete and Update

Test Steps.Step Action: Pre-requisite:\n- Have an existing Precinct
Test Steps.Step Expected: \n

Test Steps.Step Action: Access the EMS system\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: Dashboard displayed\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Navigate to District Management > Districts > Precinct\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: Precincts page will be displayed\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Find the existing Precinct and click in the "Actions" ellipsis
Test Steps.Step Expected: Options displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "Edit"
Test Steps.Step Expected: Update Precinct page is displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Under the Precinct Assignments section click on the "Precinct Splits" tab
Test Steps.Step Expected: Precincts Splits section will be displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "Split Precinct"
Test Steps.Step Expected: Precinct Split page will be displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Fill in the "Name" and "Code" required fields
Test Steps.Step Expected: Fields filled in

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "Save"
Test Steps.Step Expected: A success message will be displayed and the Precinct Split is saved

Test Steps.Step Action: Go back to the main existing Precinct by clicking "Cancel"
Test Steps.Step Expected: Update Precinct page is displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Under the Precinct Assignments section click on the "Precinct Splits" tab\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: Precincts Splits section will be displayed and the newly created Precinct Split will be listed\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on the "Actions" ellipsis
Test Steps.Step Expected: Options displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "Update"
Test Steps.Step Expected: Update Precinct Split page is displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Change the Name of the Precinct Split
Test Steps.Step Expected: Name changed

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "Update"
Test Steps.Step Expected: A success message will be displayed and the Precinct Split will be updated\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Under the Precinct Assignments section click on the "Precinct Splits" tab\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: The changes you made to the Precinct Split will be reflected here

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on the "Actions" ellipsis\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: Options displayed\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "Delete"
Test Steps.Step Expected: The Precinct Split will be removed from the list and will no longer be part of the main Precinct

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "Delete"

Title: DM-Precinct-Create a New Split Precinct

Test Steps.Step Action: Navigate to DM - District -  Precinct
Test Steps.Step Expected: Search Precincts page must be displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on "ADD"
Test Steps.Step Expected: Add Precincts page must be displayed\n\n

Test Steps.Step Expected: 1.Newly added street segment information must be added successfully and displayed in street segments tab accordingly\n2.Street name and Street segment columns must be displayed in street segments tab

Test Steps.Step Expected: Add Precinct district page must be displayed\n

Test Steps.Step Expected: 1.Newly added district information must be displayed in districts tab accordingly\n2.District type and District Name must be displayed in Districts tab

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on Precinct Splits tab and click on "CREATE PRECINCT SPLIT"
Test Steps.Step Expected: 1.Maintain Precinct Split page must be displayed\n2.Name and code fields must be prepopulated and editable

Test Steps.Step Action: Verify the split Precinct name format
Test Steps.Step Expected: First precinct split name must be "parentname"-1/2\nSecond precinct split name must be "parentname"-2/2

Test Steps.Step Action: Verify the split Precinct code format
Test Steps.Step Expected: First precinct split name must be "parentcode"-1/2\nSecond precinct split name must be "parentcode"-2/2

Test Steps.Step Action: Edit split precinct name
Test Steps.Step Expected: Must allow special characters such as /, -, (,  ), & and _

Test Steps.Step Action: Edit split precinct code
Test Steps.Step Expected: Must allow special characters such as /, -, (,  ), & and _

Test Steps.Step Action: Verify first precinct split and second precinct split are displayed in precinct splits tab
Test Steps.Step Expected: Both the precincts must be displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on Actions->Update on the first precinct split
Test Steps.Step Expected: Update Precinct disctrict page must be displayed\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Verify all the districts on the parent precinct are automatically copied on first split precinct.
Test Steps.Step Expected: All the districts on the parent precinct must automatically copied on first split precinct.

Test Steps.Step Action: Verify all the street segments on the parent precinct are automatically copied on first split precinct.
Test Steps.Step Expected: All the street segments on the parent precinct must automatically copied on first split precinct.

Test Steps.Step Action: Verify all the districts on the parent precinct are automatically copied on second split precinct.
Test Steps.Step Expected: All the districts on the parent precinct must automatically copied on second split precinct.

Test Steps.Step Action: Verify all the street segments on the parent precinct are not copied on second split precinct.
Test Steps.Step Expected: street segments should not be copied to second split precinct.

Title: 68728 - DM - District - Precinct Split - Validation Rules for Precinct Splits (P3)

Test Steps.Step Action:
Pre-requisites:
- Have at least 2 existing District Types
- Have at least 2 existing Districts that are under different District Types
- Have at least 2 existing Street Segments
Test Steps.Step Expected: \n

Test Steps.Step Action: Access the EMS system\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: Dashboard displayed\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Navigate to District Management > Districts > Precincts\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: Precinct page will be displayed\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "ADD"
Test Steps.Step Expected: Add Precincts page is displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Fill in all required fields
Test Steps.Step Expected: Fields filled

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "SAVE"
Test Steps.Step Expected: Precinct created and Precinct Assignments section is opened

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on the "Precinct Splits" tab
Test Steps.Step Expected: The Precinct Splits section is displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "CREATE PRECINCT SPLIT"
Test Steps.Step Expected: Confirm Precinct Split Creation box will display

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "Ok"
Test Steps.Step Expected: The Precinct will not be split and a message will be displayed saying "Cannot Create a Split without Segment & Districts Assigned"

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on the "Street Segments" tab and click "ADD"
Test Steps.Step Expected: Precinct Street Segment page is displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Select the Street Name of the existing Street Segment
Test Steps.Step Expected: Street Name selected

Test Steps.Step Action: Select the existing Street Segment
Test Steps.Step Expected: Street Segment selected

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "SAVE"
Test Steps.Step Expected: The Street Segment will be assigned to the Precinct

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on the "Districts" tab and click "ADD"
Test Steps.Step Expected: Precinct District page is displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Select the District Type of the existing District\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: District Type selected

Test Steps.Step Action: Select the existing District
Test Steps.Step Expected: District selected

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "SAVE"
Test Steps.Step Expected: The District will be assigned to the District

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on the "Precinct Splits" tab and then click "CREATE PRECINCT SPLIT"
Test Steps.Step Expected: Confirm Precinct Split Creation box will display\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "Ok"\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: Precinct Split will be successful and two Precinct Splits will be created, the user will be taken to the second Precinct Split page

Test Steps.Step Action: Under the Street Segments area add the same Street Segment you used before
Test Steps.Step Expected: Street Segment added

Test Steps.Step Action: Under the Districts area delete the existing District and add a different one that wasn't used before
Test Steps.Step Expected: Existing District was removed and different District is added

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "SAVE"
Test Steps.Step Expected: The Precinct Split will not be updated and a message will be displayed to the user saying "Segment Mapping Should be Unique"

Test Steps.Step Action: Under the Street Segments area delete the existing Street Segment and then add a new one that hasn't already been used
Test Steps.Step Expected: Existing Street Segment deleted and different Street Segment is added

Test Steps.Step Action: Under the Districts area delete the existing District and add the original District that was first used to create the parent Precinct
Test Steps.Step Expected: Existing District is deleted and original District is added

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "SAVE"\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: The Precinct Split will not be updated and a message will be displayed to the user saying "District Mapping Should be Unique"\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Under the Districts area keep the existing District and then add another District that hasn't been used
Test Steps.Step Expected: Existing District remains and an additional different District is added

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "SAVE"\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: The Precinct Split will be updated successfully and the user will receive a success message

Title: 69011 - DM - Standardized Search - Implement partial search, and wildcard on TOWN/REGION/COUNTY screens

Test Steps.Step Action:
Pre-requisite:
- Have an existing TOWN
- Have an existing REGION
- Have an existing COUNTY
Test Steps.Step Expected: \n

Test Steps.Step Action: Navigate to District Management > Districts > Town
Test Steps.Step Expected: Search Towns page is displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: In the Name field, enter the first few characters of the existing Town Name followed by "%" (e.g. TH%)
Test Steps.Step Expected: Data entered

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "Search"
Test Steps.Step Expected: Only the Towns beginning with those first few characters entered will displayed and your existing Town will also be shown

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "Reset"
Test Steps.Step Expected: The search criteria is cleared

Test Steps.Step Action: In the Name field, enter "%" followed by the last few characters of the existing Town Name (e.g. TE%)
Test Steps.Step Expected: Data entered

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "Search"
Test Steps.Step Expected: Only the Towns ending with those last few characters entered will displayed and your existing Town will also be shown

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "Reset"
Test Steps.Step Expected: The search criteria is cleared

Test Steps.Step Action: In the Name search field, enter "%" and then any few characters of the existing Town name followed by another "%" (e.g. %EC%)
Test Steps.Step Expected: Data entered

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "Search"
Test Steps.Step Expected: Only the Towns with those few characters entered (in that order) will be displayed and your existing Town will also be shown

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "Reset"
Test Steps.Step Expected: The search criteria is cleared

Test Steps.Step Action: In the Name search field, enter the first few characters of the existing Town Name followed by "%" and then any few characters that the name contains, followed by another "%" (e.g. T%PL%)
Test Steps.Step Expected: Data entered

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "Search"
Test Steps.Step Expected: Only the Towns that begin with those characters and contain those characters entered will be displayed and your existing Town will also be shown

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "Reset"
Test Steps.Step Expected: The search criteria is cleared

Test Steps.Step Action: In the Name search field, enter "%" and then any few characters of the existing Town Name followed by another "%" and then the last few characters of the Town Name (e.g. %CT%E)
Test Steps.Step Expected: Date entered

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "Search"
Test Steps.Step Expected: Only the Towns that finish with those characters and contain those characters entered will be displayed and your existing Town will also be shown

Test Steps.Step Action: Repeat steps 2 to 16 for Region and County areas
Test Steps.Step Expected: Region and County searches work as expected

Test Steps.Step Action: Click the 'Town Name' field
Test Steps.Step Expected: Dropdown opens

Test Steps.Step Action: Select a town from the list
Test Steps.Step Expected: Dropdown closes, field shows selection

Test Steps.Step Action: Click 'Save' button
Test Steps.Step Expected: 'Only one town can be assigned to a region' message is displayed.

Test Steps.Step Action: Click 'Cancel'
Test Steps.Step Expected: Land on 'Add / Update' region screen\nThe created region is still retained and displayed beneath 'Add / Update Region

Test Steps.Step Action: Use the previous steps to create a new region, and navigate to 'Assign Town' screen by clicking the 'Add' button
Test Steps.Step Expected: \n

Test Steps.Step Action: Click the 'Town Name' field
Test Steps.Step Expected: Dropdown opens

Test Steps.Step Action: Choose the Town previously selected, and click save
Test Steps.Step Expected: 'Town is already assigned to another region. Please select a different town' message is displayed.

Title: 69214-DM - Districts - District - Delete County

Test Steps.Step Action: Pre-requisite:\n- Have an existing County that is not assigned to anything\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: \n

Test Steps.Step Action: Access the EMS system\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: Dashboard displayed\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Navigate to District Management > Districts > County\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: Search Counties page will be displayed\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Choose a County and click on the "Actions" \n
Test Steps.Step Expected: Edit and Delete options must be displayed\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "Delete"
Test Steps.Step Expected: "Are you sure you want to delete county? This action cannot be undone" message must be displayed"

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on "OK"
Test Steps.Step Expected: 1.County must be deleted successfully and should not be displayed in grid results.\n2.Successfully deleted message must be displayed

Title: 69214-DM - Districts - District - Delete County (unsuccessful)

Test Steps.Step Action: Pre-requisite:\n- Have an existing County that is in use\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: \n

Test Steps.Step Action: Access the EMS system\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: Dashboard displayed\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Navigate to District Management > Districts > County\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: Search Counties page will be displayed\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Choose a County and click on the "Actions" \n
Test Steps.Step Expected: Edit and Delete options must be displayed\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "Delete"
Test Steps.Step Expected: "Are you sure you want to delete county? This action cannot be undone" message must be displayed"

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on "OK"
Test Steps.Step Expected: 1."This County is currently in use and cannot be deleted" message must be displayed\n2.County should not be deleted and must display in the grid results

Test Steps.Step Action: \n
Test Steps.Step Expected: \n

Title: 69328-Region User Verify District Type Button Access

Test Steps.Step Expected: The user must be logged into a specific selected region

Test Steps.Step Expected: Must display only "COUNTY' and "MUNICIPAL/LOCAL"

Test Steps.Step Expected: Must display only  "COUNTY' and "MUNICIPAL/LOCAL" District category

Test Steps.Step Expected: Must display only  "COUNTY' and "MUNICIPAL/LOCAL" District category

Test Steps.Step Expected: \n

Title: 71846-Region User -Ensure Only Region-Specific Precincts Are Visible

Test Steps.Step Action: Navigate to SM->Login as Region
Test Steps.Step Expected: Login as Region page must be displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Select a Region from the drop down and click on "Login as Region"
Test Steps.Step Expected: The user must be logged into a specific selected region

Test Steps.Step Action: Navigate to DM->Precinct
Test Steps.Step Expected: 1.Precincts Page must be displayed \n2.The Region dropdown should be prepopulated with the selected region and non-editable

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on Reset button and Verify the search results grid displays
Test Steps.Step Expected: The search results should display precincts only within the selected region.

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on "ADD" and verify District Type drop down values on \n Add District Type page
Test Steps.Step Expected: 1.The Region dropdown should be prepopulated with the selected region and non-editable\n 2. Add a new precinct and verify that the newly added precinct appears in the search results grid on the  Search Precincts page.

Test Steps.Step Expected: \n

Title: DM - Districts -Search Street Segments- Validate Street search functionality

Test Steps.Step Action: Pre-requisite: Have an existing street and a voter assigned to that street segment
Test Steps.Step Expected: \n

Test Steps.Step Action: Access EMS
Test Steps.Step Expected: Dashboard is displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Navigate to District Management > Districts > Search Street segments
Test Steps.Step Expected: Search Street segments page must be displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Select a Region and enter street name with spaces
Test Steps.Step Expected: Street name must be included in the dropdown options

Test Steps.Step Action: Enter a partial street name in the  street name
Test Steps.Step Expected: Corresponding values must be displayed in the drop down

Test Steps.Step Action: Verify the search results update dynamically in real-time as the user enters a street name.
Test Steps.Step Expected: Corresponding values must be dynamically displayed in the drop down

Title: 81998 - ES - Restrict Access to the System Management | External Interfaces | "External Interfaces" Screens for Region Users

Test Steps.Step Action: Log into the EMS system as a State User
Test Steps.Step Expected: State User logged in

Test Steps.Step Action: Navigate to System Management > Features
Test Steps.Step Expected: System Management screen is displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Check page
Test Steps.Step Expected: The "External Interfaces" button should be available

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on the External Interfaces button
Test Steps.Step Expected: External Interfaces page is displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Copy the URL
Test Steps.Step Expected: URL copied

Test Steps.Step Action: Log in as a Region User
Test Steps.Step Expected: Region User logged in

Test Steps.Step Action: Navigate to System Management > Features
Test Steps.Step Expected: System Management screen is displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Check page
Test Steps.Step Expected: The "External Interfaces" button should not be available

Test Steps.Step Action: Paste the URL into the search bar at the top of the screen and press "Enter"
Test Steps.Step Expected: The user will be taken to the Landing page for the system and a pop-up window will be displayed telling the user that they do not have access
